alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Josephine (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 1:54PM PST until January 16 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Oregon, including the following counties, Jackson and Josephine. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams to near or even above bankfull. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate rainfall currently. Recent heavy rainfall and additional rainfall is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Flooding of small streams and creeks has also occurred, including at the Little Butte Creek near Eagle Point. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Medford, Grants Pass, Ashland, Central Point, Eagle Point, Talent, Shady Cove, Jacksonville, Rogue River, Gold Hill, Butte Falls, Lower Table Rock Trailhead, Touvelle State Park, Upper Table Rock Trailhead, Britt Gardens, Jacksonville Woodlands Association Trails, White City, Dodge Bridge Jackson County Park, Roxy Ann Peak and Agate Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
